intro: Verticordia muelleriana subsp. minor, commonly known as the dwarf featherflower, is a small shrub native to the southwestern region of Western Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive, feathery inflorescences that range in color from pink to red, depending on the stage of flowering. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to the region's Mediterranean climate, with dry summers and wet winters. It is a member of the family Scrophulariaceae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
